Recap: Ed, Michelle, and Rick planned their annual barbecue. Michelle and Rick were appalled when Ed suggested canceling and taking a trip to the cabin instead. They promised they would go to the cabin by the end of the summer, but said they couldn't cancel the barbecue. Marah told Tony she wanted to throw a surprise wedding for Danny and Michelle at the barbecue. She offered to take charge of the barbecue, but the Bauer's said no. Rick asked Ed to come back to work at Cedars. Ed said he would need to hire more help for the clinic, but he didn't have the funds. Danny offered the money, but Ed declined. Danny set up the donation anyway, hoping it would give the Santos name good publicity. At the prom, Shayne and Marina danced, while Lizzie looked on in jealousy. Devries called Josh, telling him there was a rumor that Shayne was going to college. Josh assured him he was wrong. Later, Josh received word that Shayne had been drafted in the fifth round by the Chicago Cubs. He tried to tell Shayne the news, but Shayne got upset that he was being pressured before Josh could finish. Reva told Marina she thought Shayne and Marina were good together. When Marina started to feel uncomfortable from Reva's words, she went outside to escape, asking Lizzie to tell Shayne to meet her there. Lizzie lied and told Shayne she didn't know where Marina was. Ben arrived, surprising Marina. Meanwhile, a woman named Caroline Boyle told Gus and Jeffrey that, two years ago, her best friend, Bridget, disappeared after dating Ben. Gus and Jeffrey decided they needed to bring in Ben for questioning, then went to the country club to find him.
Transcript: Michelle: Oh, thank you. Okay, I'll do the salad if you and Mel do the potato salad.
Rick: Okay, you slice the tomatoes and onions for the burgers, too.
Michelle: Ugh.
Rick: Please?
Michelle: All right, all right.
Rick: Great. Deal. Done.
Michelle: And what about the chili? Should we ask Buzz for ten gallons?
Rick: Five pounds is more... You know, more people eat the hot dogs and hamburgers, anyway. And let's... You know what? We don't need the chili.
Michelle: You think?
Rick: It was horrible. Dad?
Ed: I say we skip it.
Rick: Great. It's unanimous.
Ed: No, I say we skip it. The whole thing.
Rick: What? The entire event? The Bauer barbecue? Skip it?
Ed: Why not?
Michelle: Because it's the Bauer barbecue. I mean, the whole town's going to wonder if the hosts don't show up.
Rick: Yeah, Dad. You're going to be wearing the funny hat and barbecuing the burgers. We're counting on it.
Ed: Why? Why do we have to do this?
Rick: Well, the important thing-- the important question to ask here is why not? What's the problem?

Ed: Ten years ago, we used to invite some of our close friends over. We would sit around. We would grill some hamburgers and we'd go down to the lake and watch the fireworks and that was it. When did it become this huge extravaganza?
Rick: It's always been...
Michelle: I guess a little bit more and more each year. Everyone was looking for a little tradition to hold on to.
Ed: All right, how about this? This year, why don't we just spend the holiday together-- just us, the family-- up at the cabin?
Rick: You want to be alone on the fourth of July?
Ed: Not alone. I want to be with you people. We barely see each other.
Michelle: I mean, how would we even cancel?

Rick: I mean, it's not like we send out invitations so we know who to call and cancel. This is just great. I can just see this now: Fourth of July, entire town shows up at our house, they run in the back yard expecting, hungry, and all they see is a cold barbecue, a cold Jacuzzi, and tumbleweed going across the yard.
Ed: So what are you saying? Without the barbecue, anarchy reigns?
Rick: It could happen, yes.
Ed: All right. It was a suggestion, that's all.
Michelle: The town expects a barbecue. We have to give it to them.
Ed: Oh, is that how it works?
Michelle: Yes.
Ed: So the town expects a wedding, you and Danny have to give it to them?

Tony: What are they up to?

Marah: Of course. It's the law. It's, like, the best tradition that there is in town. I love it, everybody loves it. It's perfect.
Tony: Yeah? Because I had never stayed for the whole thing, so...
Marah: No, no, no, no, no. For the plan.
Tony: The plan?
Marah: Our plan.
Tony: We have a plan?
Marah: Yeah. To get Danny and Michelle together and have a surprise wedding for them.
Tony: That's our plan?

Tammy: Or at least he could be. He said you were the prettiest girl in here tonight. Would you stop that? I'm sure if you even smile at Joey he'll ask you to dance.
Lizzie: Yeah, I don't want to dance with anyone tonight, though.

Jeffrey: It's late.
Gus: You're still working.
Jeffrey: Yeah. That door was shut.

Gus: Maybe. Caroline, this is Jeffrey O'Neill, the District Attorney. Caroline Boyle. She's here to tell us a little bit about Ben Reade. All right, Caroline. Why don't you just relax and tell the D.A. everything that you told me?
Caroline: I'm not sure.

Caroline: Yes. I don't know, it feels weird. It's not like I have enough facts to accuse anybody of anything.
Jeffrey: Don't accuse. Just tell us what you know.

Caroline: We never found out for sure. We haven't known anything for almost two years now. I've been out of town at school. I just got back and when I saw Ben Reade's name in the paper and didn't see anything about Bridget, I thought maybe they don't know.
Jeffrey: Well, who's Bridget?
Caroline: She's... she was my best friend. We'd hung out together since the second grade. She... she was so much fun.
Gus: Tell him about your senior year.

Caroline: Right. We were seniors in high school when we started playing squash because Bridget thought it'd be a great way to meet guys. And we did. We met this really cute grad student, Ben Reade. He seemed nice. He kind of flirted with both of us. But he was really into Bridget; it was obvious. So, they started seeing each other, just at the club playing squash. It was a regular thing. And then one day Bridget disappeared.
Jeffrey: Disappeared? Just gone?
Caroline: Gone. No clue. No word, nothing. It's been two years and she's still missing.
Jeffrey: Didn't we have anything on this?
Gus: Uh, well, he wasn't a suspect. I mean, they had a list of acquaintances that the girl knew, but they questioned everybody. There were no arrests, no charges, no paperwork, nothing.
Jeffrey: But you were suspicious of Ben Reade at the time?
Caroline: Maybe I'm being silly. But there were things...
Jeffrey: Things? Things that made you think that Ben Reade did something to your friend.
Caroline: Yes. That's what I'm afraid of.

Michelle: Well, the colors are generally red, white and blue. I mean, potato salad's yellow. Cole slaw is green. The burgers are brown. Oh, but we have to order the balloons right away.
Marah: Okay. Okay. But give us the list, you know? Just so we know what we're doing and I promise you, we will do most of the work. You guys just relax.
Tony: Yeah, bye. Marah. Marah, what are you doing? They said they were already going to do it.

Josh: Just five minutes, okay? I promise. I'll bring him right back. Come here with me. Excuse us.

Marina: Oh, thanks. It's the only way to go.
Reva: I'm losing mine the minute I get home.
Marina: You should take them off now, then you can dance.
Reva: (Moans) Oh, ooh, that is so much better. You're a smart girl.
Marina: No, I'm just good at survival tactics.
Reva: Well, that's a good thing to be. You know, I really like the fact that you Shayne are seeing more of each other.
Marina: Oh, great.

Reva: I mean it's showing on him, too. I mean anyone can see that he's much happier. He's more relaxed when he's with you. You seem to be happy when you're with him, too. In fact, you know, someone once told that if I learned to keep my mouth shut, that people would just open right up to me about just about anything.
Marina: Oh, yeah. Does it work?
Reva: Most nights.
Marina: (Laughs) Okay, I really need another soda. Can I get you anything or...
Reva: No.
Marina: Okay. Help. Please place to hide.
Lizzie: What?
Marina: Okay, come on, you know this joint. There must be someplace to escape, right?
Lizzie: You know what? There is a big, beautiful oak tree out back. It's past the fountain, past the lawn. You'll be all alone out there.
Marina: Okay, great. Can you tell Shayne where I am when he gets through with his dad?
Lizzie: Of course.
Marina: Okay, thank you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: I'm just so proud of you tonight, son.
Shayne: Well, I guess you didn't see me dancing, huh?
Josh: No, what I'm saying is, I look at you and I see your whole life laid out before you, so full of possibilities. And it's going to happen because of who you are.
Shayne: Find a few bourbon and branches, Dad?
Josh: No, I'm trying to be serious here, son. I just... I just love you so much.
Shayne: I love you, too, Dad. What?
Josh: Listen.
Shayne: What?

Josh: Do you remember saying that you were scared about this big decision that you had to make? You were so worried about it, right? And you weren't sure if you could do it. You wanted somebody to help you with it.
Shayne: Yeah, yeah, it's all going to be there in the morning, right? I mean that's what we decided, isn't it?
Josh: Yes.
Shayne: I mean I can at least wait to sunrise, can't I?
Josh: Son...
Lizzie: Hey, you want to dance?
Shayne: Yeah. Wait till sunrise, right?
Josh: Yes. Yes, it could wait until tomorrow. That's fine.
Shayne: Right.
Josh: Okay.
Shayne: Thanks.
Lizzie: Yeah, your dad had that look.
Shayne: Yeah, like the way too intense look thing.
Lizzie: (Laughs) It's almost like they decide to become parents. Like it's a job. (Laughs)
Shayne: Exactly. Have you seen... Do you know where Marina is?
Lizzie: No, I haven't seen her. How about that dance?
Shayne: All right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Danny: I've been telling Tony that I think Aitoro should protect Eden. He is her brother.
Tony: What do you care about who protects...

Danny: All right, you know what? I'm not going to fight about this. I'm not. All I'm saying is that you guys are having a fun time and I haven't seen you have so much in quite some time. Think about it. Julie, hey, it's me. Everything okay at the office? Good. Listen, I need you to cut a check. Yeah, $20,000 to Ed Bauer's clinic. And you know, I don't really want to make a big deal out of this, but if the newspaper should happen to find out about it, it wouldn't be such a bad thing, I guess. The Santos name could use a little good publicity these days. But more importantly, do a little investigating at the clinic. Make sure 20 grand is enough. If there's anything else they need, we'll get it to them anonymously, okay. So I'll check in with you later. All right. Thanks.
Michelle: Care to join us?
Danny: Yeah. I was just about to.
Michelle: We're arguing over the Bauer burger recipe. Only they're passing notes. Go see. Only the guy's are allowed to know the ingredients. So you should get in on that.
Danny: You think so?
Michelle: Yeah, you're a guy, you grill. That's the deal.
Danny: Well, I mean that's really more of your family's thing.
Michelle: And you're my family, baby. What?
Danny: Nothing. Your family is really something else. They heal the sick, they throw parties for the entire neighborhoods.
Michelle: Yeah, and you rebuild entire neighborhoods. Hey, you know, you're always welcomed at the table. Besides, I need a little help. I'm getting wedding pressure from all sides over there.
Danny: Well, I thought... I mean... Are you sure you still don't want to?
Michelle: Well, not... not... I mean not unless you do. I mean, you got ideas or something?
Danny: What? No. (Laughs) Honey... honey, I haven't thought about it because you told me that you didn't want to do it. I mean which I'm fine with. As long as that's what you want.
Michelle: Well, I think I like things the way they are. Don't you?
Danny: Yeah. Are you sure about that?
Michelle: God, we're pathetic, aren't we?
Danny: Why?
Michelle: Because we can't make an executive decision.
Danny: We? Ah.
Michelle: That's a good decision.
Danny: Mm-hmm.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tony: Hey, you want to go pull up the car while I make a phone call?
Marah: Yeah, I'll be right back.
Tony: Thank you. Yeah, hello. Hey, it's Tony Santos. Is he there? Thank you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
(Dance music playing)
Jeffrey: Aitoro? What are you doing here? Did you find Reade and lock him up?
Gus: No, no. I can not find anywhere.
Jeffrey: What?
Gus: I can't find him.
Jeffrey: Do you think he's skipped town?
Gus: No, his stuff is still at the house. All of his roommates say he's in town.
Jeffrey: Well, they say.
Gus: I put an A.P.B. out on him, okay.
Jeffrey: Oh, great. We got to find Frank Cooper. I've been looking for him everywhere. I can't find him either. (Frank and Darci laughing)
Darci: My God, you're so bad.
Jeffrey: Hey.
Frank: Hey! What's up fellows?
Jeffrey: We got a lead on the murder case.
Frank: Well, good. What's up? What's going on?
Jeffrey: I thought you were suppose to be keeping an eye on things here? Where have you been?
Frank: Nice to see you, too, Jeffrey. Darci, this is Jeffrey O'Neill, our District Attorney. And you know Detective Aitoro.
Jeffrey: Frank.
Darci: Nice to meet...
Frank: Well, you know what? He's really good at getting results, but he's very, very bad on manners.
Gus: Frank, this is about Ben Reade. It's about Ben Reade.
Frank: Would you excuse us for a second? Thank you. What about Ben Reade?
Gus: Right. A girl came in tonight. She's knows about his past. About years ago.
Jeffrey: Disturbing stuff, Frank.
Frank: You think this links Ben up to the murders now?
Gus: Well, it could. This guy... This guy could have some serious problems.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Shayne? Took you long enough. Your dad hold you hostage or something? Shayne? Shayne?
Ben: Guess again.
[NEXT_ON]
Phillip: Well, who else besides Olivia will want to fake the results?
Alan: Who indeed?
Frank: Shayne, have you seen Marina?
Shayne: Is everything all right? What's going on?
